nodes.description: Carlos the Jackal (Ilich Ramirez Sanchez) was born into a wealthy Venezuelan family and studied in Moscow before joining the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine
nodes.support_text: Carlos was born into a wealthy Venezuelan family, and studied in Moscow before joining the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine.

nodes.description: Carlos converted to Islam in 1975 and was convicted in France for a triple murder that same year
nodes.support_text: Carlos was already serving life in a Paris prison for a triple murder in 1975.

nodes.description: In March 1982, Carlos carried out a train bombing between Paris and Toulouse, killing 5 and injuring 28
nodes.support_text: The first bombing, in March 1982, was on a train between Paris and Toulouse, killing five people and wounding 28.

nodes.description: A month later in April 1982, Carlos bombed an anti-Syrian newspaper in Paris, killing 1 and injuring 60
nodes.support_text: followed a month later by the car bombing of an anti-Syrian newspaper in Paris. One passer-by was killed and 60 injured.

nodes.description: On New Year's Eve 1983, Carlos bombed a TGV train between Marseille and Paris, killing 3 and injuring 13
nodes.support_text: On New Year's Eve 1983, Carlos bombed a TGV train between Marseille and Paris, killing 3 and injuring 13.

nodes.description: The same day, Carlos bombed a Marseille train station, killing 2 people
nodes.support_text: and a bomb at a Marseille train station, killing two.

nodes.description: Carlos was arrested by French special forces in Sudan in 1994 after becoming infamous for attacks and hostage-takings
nodes.support_text: Carlos was captured by French special forces in Sudan in 1994.

nodes.description: In December 2011, Carlos was permanently sentenced to life imprisonment in France for the 1980s attacks following fresh evidence discovery
nodes.support_text: Self-styled revolutionary 'Carlos the Jackal' has been convicted in France of organising four deadly attacks in the 1980s and sentenced to life in prison.
Self-styled revolutionary 'Carlos the Jackal' has been convicted in France of organising four deadly attacks in the 1980s and sentenced to life in prison.

nodes.description: Carlos the Jackal被法国法庭以组织致命袭击罪名进行审判
第一次爆炸后一个月发生汽车炸弹袭击
nodes.support_text: 第一次爆炸后一个月发生汽车炸弹袭击

the other two bombings took place on New Year's Eve 1983
By that time he had earned global notoriety as a mastermind of deadly bomb attacks, assassinations and hostage-takings.
Self-styled revolutionary 'Carlos the Jackal' has been convicted in France of organising four deadly attacks in the 1980s and sentenced to life in prison.
在1994年被捕后开始审判程序
Carlos策划了四起致命袭击，其中首起发生在1982年3月的巴黎至图卢兹火车爆炸案
